conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls extruded with thickness, multiple faces visible, interior volume readable, and roof/ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and corner geometry; clear floor-vs-wall separation; elevated angled view. Cutaway is clean but overall camera is close to top-down and some interior edges read slightly softened.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout largely matches: bedrooms at top, activity central, living/kitchen to right-center, alfresco top-right, garage bottom-right, master suite bottom-left with adjacent wet areas. Some proportional drift and simplified partitioning; openings (doors/windows) are not consistently represented/located as in the plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture exists (beds, sofas, dining, kitchen island/counters, some bathroom fixtures). Some rooms appear under-furnished/simplified relative to plan intent (e.g., theatre/utility details).

visual_clarity.notes: Readable walls/floors and clean presentation. Lighting allows interior visibility with minimal artifacts; materials are consistent and unobtrusive.

detected_errors.description: Some room proportions/partition extents appear simplified or slightly shifted compared to the 2D plan (notably in internal corridor/utility partitioning and relative sizing of some spaces).
Doors/windows are not fully or accurately mapped to the 2D plan; several openings are missing or not clearly placed on the correct walls.
Furniture is simplified and some room-specific elements (e.g., theatre fitout and some cabinetry/utility details) are missing or minimal.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with largely faithful overall layout, but with simplified partitions and incomplete door/window fidelity versus the 2D plan.
